JGH Articles & Insights

The Go To Shot

More than a fallback, it could be your greatest asset.

Most of us have heard PGA/LPGA Tour players talk about their "go to shots".

Go to tshots are your safest bets. They play to your strengths, working around your limitations in favor of shots with hight probablities of getting in play

The fade shot

Over 95% of all golfers hit a "fade" or "cut" shot to make up for limitations like low rotation or an early extenstion with the hips, for example. In a fade, the angle the club makes in moving back to the ball (on to in) makes it easier to hit.

Learn your limitation

The fade shot is just one example of a got to shot. I've found success helping players find a shot that fits their limitations. If you already know your physical limitations, use them to developer the right go to shot for you. If you don't, work with a coach to discover them and then identify the right show.

When to use a go to shot
